sentences.english: Thank hypocrisy, thanks to get away with parading falsehoods suddenly sincere lies.
sentences.chinese: 感謝虛僞突然誠懇，感謝謊言弄假成真。

sentences.english: You are cordially invited to a reception to be given in our ministry on Saturday evening.
sentences.chinese: 誠懇邀請參加我部本星期六晚間舉行的招待會。

sentences.english: It sounded sincere enough, however, despite all he had done.
sentences.chinese: 不管他做過些什麼，這番話聽起來倒還很誠懇。

sentences.english: Stern as a soldier might be, but hearty, and placable always.
sentences.chinese: 嚴厲，正如一個戰士會有的性情，但總是誠懇，寬大。

sentences.english: I wouldn’t care what her religious background was, so long as she had an openmind and an honest heart.
sentences.chinese: 我不介意她的宗教背景，只要她開朗，誠懇。

sentences.english: A yes man often comes off as insincere and sleazy.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的人通常代表着不誠懇與不體面。

sentences.english: He had to make three visits before Zhuge Liang agreed to do so, impressed by his sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 諸葛亮見劉備十分誠懇，終於答應了他的請求。

sentences.english: To do anything devotedly , to treat anybody sincerely.
sentences.chinese: 忠實地做事，誠懇地對人。

sentences.english: Thank you for false suddenly sincere thanks to lie, bowfinger.
sentences.chinese: 感謝虛僞突然誠懇，感謝謊言弄假成真。

sentences.english: She sincerely apologizes to the puppy, which allows her divided psyche to heal.
sentences.chinese: 她誠懇地向死去的小狗道歉，由此治癒了分裂的人格。

sentences.english: First show review attitude, should sincerely repent thoroughly of one's misdeeds, prominent.
sentences.chinese: 首先表明檢討態度，應誠懇，突出痛改前非之意。

sentences.english: Recent research finds positive correlations with this honest show of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 最近的研究發現誠懇情感表現的正相關性。
他的演說聽起來很誠懇。

sentences.english: His sincere attitude was so moving that he attained his freedom.
sentences.chinese: 他那誠懇的態度如此感人，因此他獲得了自由。
待人誠懇，服務意識良好。

sentences.english: Treat people sincerely, work initiative seriously, full of professionalism.
sentences.chinese: 待人誠懇，工作主動認真，富有敬業精神。

definition: conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to take responsibility/to bear responsibility/to be responsible
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
